word:
Society Has Claims Upon Women.--It is woman's right to look after the interest of her husband, to have 
                                                                           159
a care for his wardrobe, and to seek to make him happy. It is her right to improve her mind and manners, to be social, cheerful, and happy, shedding sunshine in her family and making it a little heaven. And she may have an interest for more than "me and mine." She should consider that society has claims upon her. --The Health Reformer, June, 1873.
